intro: Dicliptera bupleuroides var. ciliata, commonly known as the ciliate bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and clustered inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with ciliate margins, giving it its botanical name. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in dense, flat-topped clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
